column5: Yup I am booked for Saturday morning. We will see how that works out

In '68 dad bought a cottage on Loon/Dudmon Lake in Haliburton for $8800, sold it in the late '80s for ten times that. It has been extensively renovated but I ran across it up for rent a few years ago , would have cost the same $8800 to rent for 4 weeks¬†ü§Ø

Barrie¬†‚Äì Tiffin Street ‚Äì reopens Saturday with the following guidelines: Innisfil¬†‚Äì Innisfil Beach Park with the following guidelines: Orillia¬†‚Äì Couchiching Beach boat launch and the Collins Drive boat launch will reopen Saturday: Penetanguishene¬†‚Äì boat launch and wharf will¬†NOT¬†reopen this weekend Severn Township¬†‚Äì all public boat launches and docks reopen Saturday

https://kawarthanow.com/2020/05/13/public-boat-launches-in-kawartha-lakes-to-reopen-beginning-may-14/ The municipality of Kawartha Lakes will begin opening public boat launches on Thursday, May 14th, just in time for the Victoria Day long weekend. Members of the public will be allowed to launch their boats, in groups of less than five people who maintain a physical distance of at least six feet from each other. ‚ÄúKawartha Lakes continues to take all necessary precautions to ensure the health and safety of residents and staff,‚Äù states the municipality in a media release. ‚ÄúBoat launches will continue to be monitored closely and the closures could be reinstated if the municipality sees any increased signs of risk.‚Äù

I'll lose sleep over important things, not being able to fish while a pandemic plays out isn't one of them.
With the amount of snow coming down, it looks more like a relapse of winter than spring.¬† Bull granola weather.¬† Robins have 3 little ones and worms have gone back deep.

It‚Äôs a late spring again so no rush. I have my own ramp and was out for short while a week ago when it was nice out. Lake was nice and quiet. Nice to see the return or the Loons getting ready to nest. As an avid angler I was humbled by the experience and realized that we need to slow down and not be so spoiled and impatient. I now feel that our lakes are much too busy with¬†boaters and anglers anyway. Stop and smell the air and Just listen. What¬†a beautiful country we have and we should be more appreciative for what we are so fortunate to be a part of.
Yup  I was not about to go out and sit and get soaked. South side of the bay was nice,north side was a snow squall. Of course,I wanted to fish the north side .LOL Will see what Sunday brings .

Funny thing is I picked up my flowers and tomato's last saturday morning.¬† Called 2 days ahead, placed order, picked my pick up time and paid.¬† Went there at the prescribed time,¬† person comes and gets my order number, radios it to inside, out comes the cart with my order,¬† loaded into truck and outa there in about 10n minutes.¬† Very efficient.¬†¬† Now if they would smack the dingbats in the grocery stores that just have to squeeze every damn loaf of bread and tomato, it would make me very happy.

So they open the garden gallery curbside pick up. That is great. It,s a start right ? Seems some are complaining they can not go and pick out what they want. Some people are just ignorant. Be thankful they even open. I started my mini grow today. Starting with chives . Will be starting peppers and tomatoes later after the snow fall this weekend.LOL. I have to grow everything in a large garden pot. But I am good with that. Anyone do those hanging tomato plants ?
I have one that I have used a few times.¬† They work as long as you keep them watered.
I tried for 2 years when I moved here. Didn't work for me. But I can't really blame the hanging basket system. I just don't get enough direct sun light. Got tomatoes but couldn't get them to ripen.

Hey guys now that this thread's gone off the rails (not a bad thing); try hydroponics; no matter¬†what scale (size of system) you use; it works great. I made up a system last year and couldn't believe the yield I got. Strawberries, lettuce, cabbage and peppers. Not sure what I'm putting in this year? It's easy just change the nutrients (Fertilizer) every other week and your done. No¬†weeding, no bugs (cut worms to kill your veg) just watch for Afedes;¬†a spray of dish washing soup and water will take care of them. These systems would be great for an apartment baloney,¬†¬†Build to size of space; very versatile. I have (or hopefully will have again) a summer¬†trailer and they do not allow gardens. Don't want the lots to get dug up; I guess? That's why I built this hydroponic garden. We couldn't eat the stuff as fast as it grew; so it became my neighbors veggie stand. Take what you want/need but leave me some. LOL Dan.

It was in a Peterborough news paper Direct quote from the news release.. READ THE LAST SENTENCE.... This is not etched in stone yet.  Mayor Andy Letham says the city is targeting May 12 to reopen boat launches, landfills and open the rail trail to motorized vehicles. The rail trail would usually open around May 1, but will only be open to pedestrian traffic in light of COVID-19.¬† ‚ÄúThese are outside activities. These are local decisions we can make on a local level, but it will depend on the provincial state of emergency and our local state of emergency as well,‚Äù Letham said at a media briefing on Thursday (April 23).¬†  The province recently extended its state of emergency to May 12. As that‚Äôs the day the declaration could end, that‚Äôs the day the city is targeting.¬† Related Content¬†  COVID-19 will have a 'huge impact' on local economy, says Kawartha Lakes mayor Letham stressed that anything could change between now and then with the pandemic, but he said he wanted to let residents know the city was ‚Äúworking on it.‚Äù¬† ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs things we can do there to maintain distancing and put some parameters in place,‚Äù he said.¬† ‚ÄúI just want to stress that this is not a done deal. If we can continue on the route that we‚Äôre going, we‚Äôre on a good path over the next two or three weeks, then we can look at easing some of these things back into the community if we can do it safely.‚Äù
Thanks Terry

Phase 2: Restart Ontario will take a three-stage approach to loosening emergency measures and reopening the economy: Stage 1:¬†Open select workplaces under modified operations (ex. curb-side pickup and deliveries), allow some small gatherings like funerals Stage 2:¬†Open more workplaces (may include some service industries, office and retail businesses), outdoor spaces, and allow some larger gatherings Stage 3:¬†Further relax the restrictions of public gatherings (large public gatherings like concerts and sporting events still be restricted), opening all workplaces responsibly
